(Ah logo the game is afoot.)

Lunarpine worked his way north, turned and headed east. there was a 
slight breeze coming from the west which doubled his advantage. the 
sun in her eyes, the breeze at her back, he knew that by now she'd be 
after him. "Fuzz Face?"(Come on Logo you can come up with better 
insults than that.) "Stick it in your audio receptors you feather 
weight birdbrain." 

The wolf knew she'd track his comm, he hoped she would.He worked his 
way toward the mountains, there was a series of caves there he could 
use to hide, if nothing else lived there first.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She heard him on her link.
> "Oh yeah fuzz face! That won't be for long."  She walked tot he 
> entrance of the base with her sachel on her arm and transformed 
into 
> owl mode.  She had the sachel strap over her shoulder and the 
sachel 
> under her wing.  She flew off following his signal. "Yo, fuzz face, 
> I'll be there in two shakes of a squirrels tail." she beat her 
wings 
> hard to catch up to him.  He did have a good head start.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > The sun began to rise over Tibet as it's beams of light reflected 
> > gold off the damsged hull of the Ark warmth covered a wolf 
sleeping 
> > behind a sheet of broken off metal. yet another day in the life 
of 
> a 
> > transformer.
> > 
> > The wolf rose stretching his legs, first his front, then his 
hind. 
> > His fur was ragged on the side he'd slept on, but with one good 
> shake 
> > he smoothed out his grey and white coat.
> > 
> > He knew Shadow Wing would be looking for him, unless she'd 
> forfitted 
> > thier sparring match. After the argument about his eyes he didn't 
> > know if she'd show. Unless she came out with guns blazing trying 
to 
> > cripple him so Stegotron could work his voodoo (That he do so 
> > well.)  "Well time to get started"
> > 
> > "Lunarpine to whoever, I'm going scouting to the north. I'll be 
> back 
> > later."
> > 
> > He knew that whoever was working the scanners would report his 
> > departure in the log book. If she was smart, he knew she was, 
she'd 
> > check the scanners and logbook to see where he was going, and try 
> to 
> > head him off.
> > 
> > "Give Shadow Wing a message for me, tell her she's IT." He 
figured 
> > she'd know what IT meant
